deck: A member of the Scarlet Sisterhood, and a legend among the New Vatican. This Nun brings Hell in a hand-basket. Excommunicated from the force, She was a Captain of a particular squadron of the 'Scarlet Sisterhood' before the human Adjudicators were disbanned after the creation of the 'Gabriel Units. The Sister wandered the wastelands called Perdition, found and outpost, and opened a Brothel/tavern for weary travelers, until she received a strange proposition...
description: After the days of the Atomic Baptism, when all the Heathenous nations rose against us, The separated cities of the East and those of the West, became two long coastal cities. The Atomic wasteland between, became known as 'Perdition'. To keep order in the Cities, the new Vatican sanctioned Holy Adjudicators, The Crimson Brotherhood and the Scarlet Sisterhood, Priests and Nuns with the power to dispense law and order. Among the sisterhood rose one unto legend, Sister Helena Hanbasquette, whose fury matched her righteousness on the field of battle. She was heralded as a living legend, until the genetic experiments were released, who were to be the final word in 'Divine Law'. These were 'The Evangelite' Angels created through science. But after the new Vatican became fearful and jealous of the status that the people had given to the Evangelite, a war ensued. Those who participated were excommunicated, while their superiors were held responsible. Helena was stripped of her rank and cast out into Perdition here she wandered for a year. Helena settled in an outpost town. where sh built and ran a brothel/tavern for weary travelers and outcasts. One day, a representative from the new Vatican came to her with a proposition. Her Rank and status would be returned if she helped track and capture a new member of what was believed an extinct race: a lone Evangelite.
name: Sister Helena Hanbasquette

deck:
Thrust into authority by the death of the previous Matrix bearer, Zeta Prime took on the thankless job of heading the Autobot forces in the wake of the Decepticon Uprising.

He is the successor to Guardian Prime in the original animated series and Sentinel in Autocracy.
description:
Major Story Arcs

IDW Publishing Continuity

Origin

Zeta Prime was the successor to Sentinel Prime and rose to power after Sentinel was killed by Megatron. Although he proved to be corrupt, he solidified the Autobot security forces on Cybertron into an army to fight against the Decepticon uprising.

Spotlight Blurr

Due to the terrorist threat presented by the Decepticon uprising, Zeta Prime issued an order to lock down recreational activities, including the races on Cybertron that brought Blurr his stardom. Later, the Decepticons stage a plot to assassinate Zeta Prime but Orion Pax manages to enlist Blurr to join their ranks and he manages to get the message of the plot to Zeta in time.

Autocracy

One day, at the Iacon Citadel, Zeta Prime announces to the Senate that he will stop the Decepticon uprising and restore order to Cybertron at any cost. The Senate inform him of how there are people on Cybertron who support the Decepticons and hide them, but Zeta says they will be rooted out as anyone not with them is against them. They then respond to him by telling him he is causing oppression, but he responds by telling them that the people of Cybertron aren’t too fond of their inability to implement effective actions, especially at the city of Nyon.

Zeta then reveals the Vamparc Ribbon, a weapon that was designed by Jhiaxus that he believes can out out the Decepticons for good. He then says that the only drawback is that it requires a large amount of power but that they can such power within themselves. Starscream then appears, claiming to observe, as Zeta prepares to demonstrate the power of the Vamparc Ribbon on Swindle. While using it on Swindle, he says that the Vamparc’s units draw power from the nearest available source and that they energy is volatile and that the ribbon has to be released otherwise the unit could overload. After the demonstration, he announces that they’ve fitted larger Vamparc cannons to the Omega Destructors but that they will require even more power. When the senate asks him how he will obtain the energy for their unites, Zeta says that they’ll simply take it by force from dissidents after burning down their enclaves. While the senate denounce his plan and tell him the people will turn against them if they attempted to implement such a plan, Zeta tells them he already began and that they started siphoning energy under the dissidents’ attention at Nyon. The senate are then outraged from his actions, but Zeta says that the security council lost the will to do what was necessary and that he was chosen as Prime because he’s the monster the people need. Although the senate continue to rage at his response, Starscream tells them that losing a few dissident sectors is worth stopping the Decepticons. Zeta tells Starscream he’s surprised he accepted his plan, and Starscream nearly tells him that he had done worse in Megatron’s name, but compromises Soundwave’s position in the room to distract Zeta. As Soundwave escapes, Zeta sends Orion Pax and his team of Autobots after him. Orion fails to stop Soundwave and is captured and taken to Megatron, who then shows Orion Zeta’s plans.

After Orion escapes with the help of other Autobots, he is scolded by Zeta Prime for failing to stop Soundwave after he had obtained such important info. Orion tells Zeta that the Decepticons are their enemies and not the civilians, and Zeta tells him not to judge him and criticizes him for having been ambushed a second time, saying he lacks the subtlety and strength for true leadership. Orion tells him he believes they were set up, but Zeta dismisses it as an excuse and then prepares another mission for him while telling him that if he fails it he will be left to the Decepticons. Later, at the Operations Center, Zeta assigns Orion Pax and his team to capture the “Mystery Bomber” who ambushed them in Nyon and tells them that the only lead they have on him is that his name is Hot Rod.

The Autobots eventually find Hot Rod, and he shows them that Zeta has been bleeding the people of Cybertron dry of any energy. As the Autobots begin questioning who the real problem is, Zeta Prime launches an attack on Nyon with the Omega Destructors while telling the people of Nyon that they have been branded as traitors and that he will drain all the energon from the city while saying it will be used to serve the greater order. The Autobots ultimately choose to fight against Zeta and his Omega Destructors but after finding they are too powerful, Hot Rod detonates the phase-charges that were wired throughout the city, destroying it and taking the Omega Destructors with it. Zeta Prime then confronts Orion Pax and tells him that it’s not about choosing the right side but the side that’s going to win. Orion tries to fight against him, but Zeta overpowers him with a Vamparc ribbon. As Zeta prepares to finish off Orion Pax, Megatron and the Decepticons attack him. Zeta then prepares to use the Vamparc cannon on Megatron, Megatron - knowing all about the weapon and its properties - sacrifices a bunch of dissidents to the ribbon which causes it to start overloading. He tells Zeta that he can either risk it backfiring, or he can get rid of it and fight him fairly but Zeta chooses to retreat.

After the Decepticons take the Autobots in for repairs, Oroin pax and the Autobots form an alliance with the Decepticons to stop Zeta Prime. Back at the Iacon Citadel, a senator tells Zeta that his attack has emboldened the Decepticons and their sympathizers and that Orion Pax and his unit are unaccounted for, but Zeta disregards him and tells him that Orion Pax has been crushed and that the Destructors are more than a match for the Decepticons. The Autobots and Decepticons then begin attacking the citadel, and Zeta Prime mobilizes the Vamparc cannons and Omega Destructors. During the assault, Orion Pax and Megatron break into the citadel and confront Zeta Prime. Zeta, armed with a Vamparc cannon, begins battle with them and although he overpowers Orion, Megatron manages to disarm him of his weapon and he then taunts him by telling him that he’s nothing without it. Zeta then grabs Megatron and prepares to kill him, but Megatron fires his fusion cannon through Zeta’s head, killing him.

Other Media

Video Games

Transformers: War for Cybertron - Zeta Prime appears as the leader of the Autobots before Optimus Prime.

Transformers: Fall of Cybertron - Zeta Prime appears as one of 5 downloadable characters in the Havok pack for the multi-player aspect of the game. Zeta Prime's alternate form is a Cybertronian muscle car with six wheels.

deck: A genetic clone of Jesus Christ, who grew up in front of the world on a reality TV show. Later in life, Chris rebels against all things religious by becoming an atheist and using his celebrity to front a punk rock band.
description:
Origin

Chris was created by the J2 project as a clone of Jesus Christ.

Creation

Chris was created by Punk Rock Jesus writer/artist Sean Murphy. His first appearance was in Punk Rock Jesus #1 - Conception.

Punk Rock Jesus

Chris was created in a laboratory using cells taken from the shroud of turin in an attempt to clone Jesus Christ as part of a reality TV show called the J2 Project. The embryo was then placed in Gwen Fairling, who was hired to be his "virgin mother."

Chris was brought up on the island owned by the J2 project, and received little education other than the religious teaching that they gave him. When he tries to perform a miracle, he fails, almost leading to him drowning. His mother, wishing for him to have a normal childhood, has him placed in a public school. Although he is very intelligent, Chris has trouble fitting in, mainly due to his bodyguard, Thomas, intimidating people.

After his mother is killed during an attempt at freeing him, Chris decides to rebel against the J2 project, becoming an outspoken atheist and joining a punk rock band called the Flak Jackets, declaring war on all things religious. His music becomes very popular with the scientific community, but receives widespread protest from the religious. Ignoring Thomas's warnings, Chris decides that he is taking the band to a performance in Jerusalem.

However, before making it to their performance, their van was attacked, killing the band's lead guitarist and causing Chris to cancel their tour. He meets with Sarah Epstein, who reveals that her daughter is actually Chris's twin sister.

During a television interview, he is attacked by members of the New American Christians, a fundamentalist organization that was present for most of Chris' life. In a response to Chris' outspoken Atheism, they fire on the helicopter that Chris was in, killing him.

A statue of him is built at the site of the J2 Project to commemorate his life.
name: Chris Fairling

deck: American astronaut who underwent a metamorphosis when exposed to an energy rift in space.  His consciousness is now shared among crows.
description:
Origin

Murder was an American astronaut who was reluctantly sent into space on a mission to find out if the Soviets were up to anything. A crow stowed away in his shuttle as he approached a tear in the universe. His shuttle came back without him as he later reappeared as a telepathic flock of crows. He has no recollection of anything after his mission in 1960.

Creation

Murder was created by writers Michael Moreci and Steve Seeley.

Current Events

Since Murder's debut he has been featured as a prominent member of the Hoax Hunters.

Major Story Arcs

Getting Away with Murder

for more information: Hoax Hunters

When an old space suit being carried by crows starts terrorizing people in present day Moscow, the Hoax Hunters head off to investigate. They search for clues at the Museum of the History of Cosmonautics. They find that a photo is missing of a Friedrich Braun, Nazi scientist brought to Russia after the war, and head to his home. There the team finds the suit holding Braun captive with crows. The suit flees as Regan chases after him. The suit is captured by Luzhin, a mad Soviet scientist, who plans to drain the cosmic energy stored in the suit from the rift in the universe. The crows flock the machine and overload it, seemingly killing both the suit and Luzhin. As the Hoax Hunters later attempt to bury the suit another flock of crows fly into the suit and animate it while a telepathic consciousness introduces itself as Murder to Ken and asks to join the team.

The roughly 18 year old Regan is part of a group who claim to find out whether anonymous tip of the supernatural are hoaxes are not. The team travels where ever the wind blows and are first met in Louisiana. The team are especially intrested with occult and cryptic experiences. The exact origins of the team is unknown, but it would appear that as the comics go on flashbacks of the different members of the team will be revealed. The team is based on various television programmes in which people attempt to prove sightings of the supernatural as hoaxes.

Creators

Steeve Seeley and Michael Moreci are the creators of this comic and are the authors whilst Axel Medellin is the illustrator. The comics belong in the Image world (ie its made by Image) and therefore may finds its way into the DC universe.

Powers and Abilities

It is unclear but as the story unravels it seems that Regan is developing telepathy as well as telekinesis She also appears to have awareness of spirits not of an Earthly realm.

Appearance

Regan is roughly 18 and 5ft8 weighing approximately 100lbs she often wears shorts sunglasses and a vest/t-shirt which complements her ginger hair.

deck: Leader of The Saviors.
description:
Origin

Before the zombie outbreak, Negan was a high school coach. He loved his wife Lucille very much, despite having an affair with another woman. When his wife got cancer, he broke off his affair, much to the chagrin of his wife, who asked him why he had choosen the sick one. Apparently, she cared so much for him, she's rather see him happy with the other woman than being sad at her side. Staying at her side in the hospital, the zombie virus broke out. The hospital nurses demanded he'd leave, because it wasn't save there anymore, but Negan refused to leave his wife. However, he soon discovered she had died. Watching zombies through the hospital window, his wife Lucille had turned behind Negan's back into a zombie.

Brief History

Negan, with other members of The Saviors, ambushed Rick and his small group after they agreed to set camp for the night while they were on their way to The Hilltop to enlist Jesus to help them against The Saviors. After lining everyone up and explaining to them how things were going to be from now on he decided that they should be punished for killing his men and not following his orders. Eventually, Glenn was the unfortunate one to get the short end of the stick.

Personality

Negan has a odd but unique personality. He is the leader of a group called the Saviors, he is feared and respected as a king, but his characteristics cannot be dubbed exactly evil. He is rarely seen without his beloved barbed wire-covered baseball he lovingly calls Lucille.

While he can of course be unmerciful, for instance he killed Glen by smashing his brains in with his baseball bat just to simply get a point across. But at the same time he spared both Carl for killing his men, and Rick as well, for attacking him in front of his people. He seems quite reasonable when someone decides to negotiate with him; he was very friendly to Carl and had even apologized to him for making him uncomfortable about his condition. Let's not forget about his use of a hot iron on the face to mark those who betray him.

But despite the fact that he isn't exactly a 'tyrant' and can be quite friendly at times, he still has a habit of provocation and likes to play in power games. He took imminence joy in making Rick look like his "b*tch" in front of his people, and had even teased Rick about his son, which was the cause of the attack.

Even Now, They Still Find New Ways to Dispose of the Dead
After All This Time, She Should Be More Prepared
Directo A La Guerra Capítulo 2 de 3
Lo Que Viene Después Capítulo 3 de 3

name: Negan

volume_credits.name: The Walking Dead, All Out War AP Edition
Image Giant-Sized Artist's Proof Edition: The Walking Dead #100

deck: One of the villains under Terminus' direction, who has Batman's bootprint scarred into his face, after fighting the Dark Knight with a flame thrower.
description:
Origin

Little is know about Bootface's origin other then at one point Batman kicked him in the face while he was using a flamethrower and the boot print became permanent.

Creation

Bootface was created by Peter J. Tomasi, Patrick Gleason and Mick Gray for there run on Batman and Robin.

Major Story Arcs

Batman and Robin:Terminus

Bootface has been enlisted into Terminus's army of revenge along with Smush, Scallop, Bat Head and several others that blame the Batman for there current conditions. After the initial meeting, where its revealed that each member had been working for Terminus for some time but never knew it, the army is sent out to spread fear. Their mission is to brand as many people withe the Batman's logo before the sun comes up. This is something that Bootface takes great pleasure in. Then when the Bat Family shows up to stop the group, both Damian and Jason Todd take pleasure in kicking Bootface in the face. After Terminus is defeated it is assumed Bootface, along with the rest of the army is taken away to jail.

Powers and Abilities

Bootface does not seem to possess and super natural powers.
name: Bootface

volume_credits.name: DC Comics The New 52 Villains Omnibus

deck: A villain under Terminus' hire who was permanently scarred by Batman after being pierced with the ejecting spikes from his gauntlets.
description:
Origin

Little is known about Scallop's origin save that she was once robbed someone at gun point, Batman hit her with his gauntlet spikes in the neck and through her ear. After that Scallop seemed to grow and obsession with piercings and revenge on Batman. She seems to have added more Batman type spikes through her arms and neck and has many more face piercing after her run in with the Batman.

Creation

Scallop was created by Peter J. Tomasi, Patrick Gleason and Mick Gray for their run on Batman and Robin.

Major Story Arcs

Batman and Robin Terminus

Scallop has been enlisted into Terminus's army of revenge along with Smush, Bootface , Bat Head and several others that blame the Batman for there current conditions. After the initial meeting, where its revealed that each member had been working for Terminus for some time but never knew it, the army is sent out to spread fear. Their mission is to brand as many people withe the Batman's logo before the sun comes up. Scallop is enjoying sharing her pain with the people of Gotham, until the Bat Family shows up she is knocked out by Dick Grayson. It is assumed that after Terminus's army's defeat Scallop and the others are taken to jail.

Forever Evil

Along with Bootface and Bat Head, Scallop was charged by the Secret Society to round up and execute dozens of lawyers and other "powerful Gothamites" at the Gotham City Courthouse and hang their bodies by the East River for all the world to see. Scallop gleefully carries out her task, slaughtering many innocent people before she is thwarted and captured by Two-Face in his war on crime. She eventually escapes his clutches, the only known survivor of Two-Face's perverse sense of "justice."
name: Scallop

volume_credits.name: DC Comics The New 52 Villains Omnibus

deck: Lead scientist of the J2 project, who was able to clone Jesus Christ.
description:
Origin

Sarah Epstein is a genetic scientist who agreed to work for the J2 project in order to receive funding for her experiments.

Creation

Sarah Eptein was created by Punk Rock Jesus writer/artist Sean Murphy.

Major Story Arcs

Sarah Epstein works as the genetic scientist for the J2 project, being in charge of both cloning Jesus Christ from cells found on the Shroud of Turin, and also changing the genetic information in order to suit the desires of her boss, Slate. Although she frequently disagrees with the actions taken by Slate, she remains working for the project in order to receive the funding she needs for her research. When Chris is born, they are shocked to find that he had a twin sister, which Slate says he will send to a foster home. Following him after work, Sarah is shocked to see him kill the child and dispose of her body.

Using an anonymous sperm donor, Sarah becomes pregnant and gives birth to a baby girl named Rebekah, who quickly becomes friends with Chris.

After the death of Chris's mother, Gwen, Sarah agrees to teach Chris all she knows about science, which helps to begin his decision to become an atheist. After Chris leaves to join a punk rock band, she stays at the J2 compound to continue her research, but warns Chris that he shouldn't attack religion as much as he has been because it may lead to his death.
name: Sarah Epstein

deck: An Ex-IRA terrorist, and current security specialist of Project J2, keeping the clone of Jesus Christ and project workers safe from attack.
description:
Origin

Thomas was the son of two members of the IRA. During an attack on their house when he was a child, his father handed him a shotgun and told him to hide in the closet until the fight is over. Hearing footsteps outside the door, he fired, accidentally killing his parents. His uncle then takes him in, and trains him to fight for the IRA as well. Although he had no problems killing adults, he refused to hurt children. When an attack planned by the IRA lead to a school bus being in the line of fire, Thomas attempted to remove it from the scene. There was only one child fatality on the bus, and Thomas was arrested for his ties to the IRA.

Creation

Thomas was created by Punk Rock Jesus writer/artist Sean Murphy.

Major Story Arcs

Punk Rock Jesus

After serving time in prison for murder, Thomas is recruited as head of security for the J2 project. During his time there, he worked to defend Chris from groups that would seek to attack him, and made an agreement with his mother (Gwen Fairling) to do so. After Chris leaves to compound to become the lead singer of a punk rock band, he followed as their chief of security.
name: Thomas McKael

deck: The virgin mother of Chris, the clone of Jesus Christ.
description:
Origin

Ophis (the company behind J2) choose Gwen out of everyone to be the mother of the clone of 'Jesus Christ'. Gwen agrees to work for J2 in order to keep her parents from having to go through with the foreclosure of their house. Slate makes Gwen dye her hair and be given breast implants to be more 'American'.

Creation

Gwen was created by Punk Rock Jesus writer/artist Sean Murphy.

Major Story Arcs

Punk Rock Jesus

Gwen gives birth to the Jesus clone and decides to name the baby Chris.

Whilst being forced to stay on the island Fairling becomes great friends with Sarah Epstein, and even a love interest to Thomas McKael.

However the stress of being constantly filmed slowly gets to her, and she becomes an alcoholic. After attempting to run away with Chris, she is forced out of the project to live on her own.

After an attempted suicide, she becomes deeply religious, believing that she had been saved by an angel. When she once again attempts to rescue Chris from his life on J2, she is killed when Slate has the door shut while she is jumping through it.
name: Gwen Fairling

deck: The technical assistant to Thomas McKael on the J2 Project.
name: Tim

deck: The corporate head of the J2 Project, who is more interested in the ratings and spectacle of the project, than the well being of any of it's participants.
name: Slate

deck: Dr. Lyle Asay is one of the doctors who works alongside Dr. Alyson Grace and their monkey Gregory.  Unlike Dr. Grace he does not speak American Sign Language.
description: Dr. Asay has his Doctorate as both a Veterinarian and in human Medicine. He graduated from school early, taking both at the same time. He is also an fan of comic books and superheroes.
name: Dr. Lyle Asay

deck: A Czarnian Princess and Lobo's love.
description: Sheba is the only known surviving Czarnian other then Lobo. Lobo having killed all the rest. She is the only life that he cares about other than his own. She went missing after Starpoint the ship she was on got attacked by pirates and crash landed on Earth.
name: Sheba

deck: Sycamore was one of the mutants competing for a vacant spot in the ranks of X-Force/X-Statix.
description:
Brief History

Sycamore has a tree-like body made of wood. His hands and feet have root-like appendages which can extend in length to attack and contain opponents. His body is giantic in size. However his appendages can be severed, incapacitating him with pain.

He competed with other mutants for the vacant spot of X-Force/X-Statix. He reportedly had a decent record of victories, but lost fingers (and a fight) to the ant-like Mant.
name: Sycamore

deck: Mant was a mutant competing for an empty spot in the ranks of X-Force/X-Statix.
description:
Brief History

Mant has an ant-like appearance, complete with insect-like eyes,antennae on his head, and external mandibles (jaws). His mandibles have crushing strength, sufficient to break solid wood into splinters. His compound eyes give him a very large view angle, and can presumably detect fast movement and electromagnetic waves. Things invisible to the human eye but visible to ants. His antennae can presumably detect chemicals, air currents, and vibrations. All within the ability of a common ant. It is uncertain if he can also use them for communication.

He was one of the mutants competing for a vacant spot in X-force/X-Statix. He was able to win a fight against Sycamore. While tiny in comparison to his opponent, Mant managed to severe the fingers reaching for him.
name: Mant

deck: Lightning Bug was one of the various mutants competing for a vacant spot in X-Force/X-Statix.
description:
Brief History

Lightning Bug dressed himself in a green-and-black costume. His boots and gloves included lightning-shaped images. Hinting at his codename and electricity-based powers.

He was one of the mutants competing for a vacant spot in X-Force/X-Statix. He was easily defeated by Washout, send flying with a single blast of water.
name: Lightning Bug

deck: The judicial member of Bellman's Crew
description:
Origin

He was a member of the Bellman's Crew, which was of course led by Bellman. This expedition hunted Snarks. When they reached Snark Island, the Barrister had a dream a Snark was defending a pig in a sty. However, when his comrade, the Baker, apparently found a Snark (which was a Boojum), he disappeared. The expedition was ended after that.

Creation

The Barrister was created by Lewis Carroll in his 1874 nonsense-poem "The Hunting of the Snark". He was illustrated by Henry Holiday.

In 2002, Alan Moore took up the crew in the second volume of League of Extraordinary Gentlemen. Instead of hunting for Snarks, they were an expedition who ventured down the rabbit hole. The Barrister was among the members of the crew which returned insane. He is only mentioned. Only the Bellman appears.

In 2011, Roger Langridge created a comic called Snarked, which was based on Carroll's original poem. In the #0 issue, Henry Holiday's original illustrations were reprinted along with Carrol's poem and the Barrister appeared in a few of those illustrations. In issue #1, Langridge retold Hunting of the Snark in his own words. However, it was not until issue #3 that the Barrister and the rest of the crew joined the cast of Snarked.

Major Story Arcs

Bellman Expedition (League of Extraordinary Gentlemen)

The Barrister was a part of the Bellman Expedition, which went down the "Rabbit Hole" like Miss A.L. He and the rest of the crew did return, but they were insane.

Snarked

Following the events at Snark Island, the crew returned home. They were considered the laughing stock of the town because no one believed their story. Even the Baker's brother, the Barber, had his doubts. In order to get any work, they changed the name of their ship from "Snark Hunter" to "Old Gratitude".

When Wilburforce J. Walrus and Clyde McDunk needed a ship to take Queen Scarlet and Prince Rusty in search of her father, the Red King. Only Old Gratitude and her crew would take then. Of course, this was before they knew where they were going. However, they were persuaded by Mr. Walrus, who is a conman, that their friend the Baker had not disappeared forever but merely was sent forward in time. Believing his tall tale, the crew decided to continue taking the Walrus and the Carpenter and royals to Snark Island.

On their journey, they have faced the Mad Hatter's pirate crew and the fiendish Gryphon. Most recently, they have reached Snark Island and have saved the Red King, but they are now stranded on the island.

Fit the Eighth: The Frumious Bandersnatch
Fit the Sixth: Yo Ho Ho and a Nice Cup of Tea
Fit the Fifth: How Doth the Little Crocodile...?
Fit the Third: Impossible Things Before Breakfast

name: Barrister

deck: Anti-Matter was one of the mutants competing for a vacant spot in X-Force/X-Statix.
description:
Brief History

Anti-Matter appears to be a skeleton-like being, emitting energy. He wears a containment suit, either to protect his form from dispersing into thin air or to protect others from the effects of his powers.

He introduced himself to a television audience, announcing his name and New York-based activities.

Note on appearance

The overall appearance of the character resembles the "Spooky Space Kook" (sic), a Scooby-Doo foe first depicted in a 1969 episode. The Kook is depicted as "a skeletal phantom-like creature with huge dull, and pale yellow eyes inside of a spacesuit".
name: Anti-Matter

deck: A small hedgehog whose family is from Africa.
description: He appeared in one strip.
name: Pygmy hedgehog

deck: A hedgehog with big ears.
description:
Creation

He was created by Milla Paloniemi.
name: An Egyptian long eared hedgehog.

deck: The feisty, on-again off-again-girlfriend of Cursing hedgehog.
description:
Creation

She was created by Milla Paloniemi.
name: Girl hedgehog

deck: Solomon O'Sullivan was a mutant who worked as a press agents for super-powered individuals or their families.
description:
Solomon O'Sullivan claims to have partial Jewish and Irish ancestry. His powers emerged when he was 19-years-old. His torso fills itself with printed words and little messages. Most of them completely random and without his conscious control. His skin peeled daily, allowing him to use the discared skin shells as reading material or cards.

He worked as a press agent. His clients included Venus Dee Milo and several of the would-be members of X-Force/X-Statix. He was able to charm Mrs. Sawyer (mother of U-Go Girl) to employ his services, convincing her that she could profit from the publicity generated by the death of her daughter. He also introduced himself to the active members of X-Force and tried to convince them to sign contracts with him.

He was less-than-happy when Venus Dee Milo joined X-Force without his consent, violating the terms of her contract. He hired lawyer Sharon Ginsberg to act against X-Force. Meanwhile, he organized the debut of his own team: O-Force. Who were easily defeated by Arnie Lundberg.

When Sharon was assaulted and mutilated by "Bad Guy", Solomon transported her to a hospital. She awoke manifesting new mutant powers and a murderous rage. He was her first victim, easily killed.

issue_credits.name: The Moons Of Venus Conclusion: The Dark Dimension
Moons of Venus Part 2: it's Official!
Moons of Venus Part 1: Good Guy, Bad Guy
Good Omens Part 4 - Talking About Edie With Arnie
Good omens Part 3 of 5:  That's Entertainment!
Good omens part 2 of 4: How the Super-Hero business works
Good omens part one: Eddie Sawyer saved my life

name: Solomon O'Sullivan

deck: Robyn Hood is a robot created for the purposes of spying on the Occupy Wall Street Movement.
description:
The robot originally named RG-026 was grown from mutant DNA and created by Shelley Godwin for Blackbird Security for the purposes of spying on the Occupy Wall Street Movement, possibly to ensure the interests of National Federal Bank. As such, she was coded to have the personality of a person who would be a part of the movement.

During a robbery, her jetpack shorted out, so she had to be rescued by Spider-Man and Captain Marvel (Carol Danvers) and put her up against the Boston P.D's new armour range.

Statistics

Height- Variable.

Weight- Variable.

Eyes- Hazel

Hair- Red

Powers and Abilities

With the aid of her suit Robyn is able to fly and shoot with guns on her wrists. She also seems to be able to absorb energy and use it to increase her own size, strength and stamina.
name: Robyn Hood

volume_credits.name: Avenging Spider-Man: The Good, the Green and the Ugly

deck: A young Wavemaster who joined the world with friend making in mind, though he fails to succeed at casting out his shy tendencies.
description: Considered to be a near identical twin to Tsukasa based on appearance, with only differences in the color of his character and his facial tattoos. Elk is a very insecure person with a dispirited attitude towards trusting others. Although he eventually trusts kite as a friend and begins warming up to many of the other characters. He often searches for an item known as Aromatic Grass with his partner Mia.

description: Kite being one of the few characters she can tolerate for long periods of time, may be her only real friend in The World. Her choice of Long Arm branches from her presidency of the Naginata club in her school. Her name comes from her love for plant life, and mostly flowers.
name: Gardenia

deck: A tenant in the storey-building of Monsieur Jean.
description:
Creation

Mrs. Colin was created by Philippe Dupuy and Charles Berberian.

issue_credits.name: Les femmes et les enfants d`abord

name: Mrs. Colin

deck: A character in the series Monsieur Jean.
description:
History

Felix`s brother isn`t a family man. He lives in Australia, and the last time he met his family was in his and Felix`s grandmothers funeral.

Their grandmother had informed of Jews to nazis, with her husband (the grandfather of Felix and his brother). Felix`s brother knew of this before Felix did. He didn`t want to see their grandparents. This led to a fight between him and his parents, which is why he moved to Australia. They had got money out of it, that Felix and his bro inherited. At first Felix thought that the whole thing is awful. Then he thought that he could take care of Eugene (his son) with that money. But Felix`s brother talked him out of it, and they decided to donate the money to some Jewish fund.

Felix`s brother tricked him, though. He had fled to Australia again, with the money.

Creation

He was created by Philippe Dupuy and Charles Berberian.
name: Felix`s brother

deck: A member of Bellman's Crew who can only kill Beavers, but is friends with the beaver
description:
Origin

He was a member of the Bellman's Crew, which was of course led by Bellman. This expedition hunted Snarks. However, when his comrade, the Baker, apparently found a Snark (which was a Boojum), he disappeared. The expedition was ended after that.

Creation

The Butcher was created by Lewis Carroll in his 1874 nonsense-poem "The Hunting of the Snark". He was illustrated by Henry Holiday.

In 2002, Alan Moore took up the crew in the second volume of League of Extraordinary Gentlemen. Instead of hunting for Snarks, they were an expedition who ventured down the rabbit hole. The Butcher was among the members of the crew which returned insane. He is only mentioned. Only the Bellman appears.

In 2011, Roger Langridge created a comic called Snarked, which was based on Carroll's original poem. In the #0 issue, Henry Holiday's original illustrations were reprinted along with Carrol's poem and the Butcher appeared in a few of those illustrations. In issue #1, Langridge retold Hunting of the Snark in his own words. However, it was not until issue #3 that the Butcher and the rest of the crew joined the cast of Snarked.

Major Story Arcs

Bellman Expedition (League of Extraordinary Gentlemen)

The Butcher was a part of the Bellman Expedition, which went down the "Rabbit Hole" like Miss A.L. He and the rest of the crew did return, but they were insane.

Snarked

Following the events at Snark Island, the crew returned home. They were considered the laughing stock of the town because no one believed their story. Even the Baker's brother, the Barber, had his doubts. In order to get any work, they changed the name of their ship from "Snark Hunter" to "Old Gratitude".

When Wilburforce J. Walrus and Clyde McDunk needed a ship to take Queen Scarlet and Prince Rusty in search of her father, the Red King. Only Old Gratitude and her crew would take then. Of course, this was before they knew where they were going. However, they were persuaded by Mr. Walrus, who is a conman, that their friend the Baker had not disappeared forever but merely was sent forward in time. Believing his tall tale, the crew decided to continue taking the Walrus and the Carpenter and royals to Snark Island.

On their journey, they have faced the Mad Hatter's pirate crew and the fiendish Gryphon. Most recently, they have reached Snark Island and have saved the Red King, but they are now stranded on the island.

deck: An alien princess who used the power of Kubik to steal stars, prompting Cloud's visit to Earth.
description:
This Star-Thief is not to be confused with either of the other Star-Thieves, Ditmal Pirval or Barry Bauman, even though Bauman's story, and even his psychic aura, are very similar to hers.

The Star Thief was a princess of an alien race. She was wounded by a laser that went into her brain, and she went into a coma. The laser caused her great pain, and made her hate and fear all small lights.

She had an extremely strong will, as she was accustomed to getting her way as a princess. She was also probably psychic to an unknown degree. The factors combined to let her take advantage of the power of Kubik, who had only recently grown up from his earlier stage as a Cosmic Cube. Cosmic Cubes are able to give their owner whatever wish they desire. The Star-Thief was able to use Kubik's wish-granting power even though he was in space, not near her.

She used her will to cause all the small lights near her--the night-time stars--to disappear. She took them out of normal space and placed them in a pocket dimension at an alarming rate--if she kept going, all the stars in the universe would soon disappear. However, no one knew that she was doing this--the stars simply disappeared from space without a trace, and their planets froze, killing untold billions.

Some of these stars were sentient, and screamed out to the other stars. One, a nascent star in nebula form named Cloud, heard them and became very fearful. Kubik felt her fear and, being inspired by the heroism of Earth's superheros, wanted to help. He condensed her to human scale , then sent her to Earth to get help. Unfortunately there were complications and she forgot her mission. Eventually, with the help of the Defenders, she finally remembered, and they all traveled to space to meet Kubik.

Kubik didn't know that the Star-Thief was using his power to eradicate the stars, and wanted to join in the Defenders' mission. He took on the form of Captain America and joined them on their quest. With the help of some other aliens, who star had been stolen, Cloud, Kubik, and the Defenders found the Star-Thief's planet. Her face appeared via psychic projection and threatened them with destruction, but they eventually found her comatose body and convinced her to stop stealing the stars. Kubik then returned the stars to their rightful places.

She eventually recovered from her coma.
name: Star-Thief

description:
Origin

Ashalata was a widow in her third year of mourning when she met Colonel Cathcart meets, a westerner. Living in Nasik, an Indian city in Maharashtra, the locals were a superstitious lot and did not approve of the match, or the subsequent child of that match. Ashalata would hear the people and even her own servants whisper behind her back about herself and her son, Vimal. Not wanting her son to have to deal with the whispers or taunts, she sent him to his father at the English military school.

Creation

Ashalata Devi is a character in Untouchable, a one shot written by Mike Carey and Samit Basu, it was released Dynamite Entertainment in 2010.

Origin

Colonel Edward Yeames Cathcart meets widowed Indian woman Ashalata Devi a few years after she loss her husband. The two share a romantic connection and despite the stigma attached with interracial relationships at the time, the two engage in a relationship. Vimal Dhatri is the result of their physical union. As a half English and half Indian boy, he faces prejudice from multiple sources, even his father bears a shame towards his son for his mixed heritage.     
 

Creation

Edward Yeames Cathcart is a Dynamite Entertainment comic book character, created by Mike Carey with art by Ashok Bhadana. Cathcart first appears in Untouchable released in 2010.

deck: Carmen Sandiego is the ringleader of the V.I.L.E. criminal organization, and a rogue agent of the ACME Detective Agency.
description:
Origin

Creation

Carmen Sandiego is the main antagonist from the Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? educational computer games that was originally created by Brøderbund Software in 1985. DC Comics later began a short four issue comic series based on the game series and published it from June of 1996 through January 1997.

Her first comic appearance was in Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? Vol. 1 "Shop Till You Drop!!!".

Character Evolution

Major Story Arcs

Powers & Abilities

Other Media

Games

Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? originally began as a series of educational PC games published by Brøderbund Software in 1985. The series mainly focused on teaching players about both geography and history. Several versions of this first iteration would be created for the Amiga, Apple II, Commodire 64, DOS, Macintosh. Sega Master System, Sega Genesis, NES, SNES, and TurboGrafix-CD.

Brøderbund Software would publish this game series from 1985 through 1996. The Learning Company then began publishing in 2001, and a Facebook version would be created in 2011.

Television

Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? (1991)

Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? is the title of a children's game show that was created by PBS in September 30, 1991. Several children would be quizzed on geography through three rounds as they tried to track down Carmen Sandiego and the members of her criminal organization. It was hosted by Greg Lee, who played the role of a ACME agent there to guide new recruits. The series lasted for five seasons and the last episode aired on December 22, 1995.

Carmen appeared in every episode of this game show, and she was heard in phone taps as she plotted with the criminal the contestants were tasked with capturing. The voice of Carmen is uncredited.

Where on Earth Is Carmen Sandiego? (1994)

Where on Earth is Carmen Sandiego? is the first animated cartoon series created based on the video games. It was developed by Phil Harnage, directed by Joe Barruso, and aired on Saturday mornings on FOX starting in February 5, 1994. The series lasted for forty episodes, the last of which aired on January 2, 1999. In February 2012, Mill Creek Entertainment released all four seasons on DVD.

Carmen was voiced by Rita Moreno in this series.

Where in Time Is Carmen Sandiego? (1996)

Where in Time Is Carmen Sandiego? is the sequel to the first children's game show that was also created by PBS starting in October 7, 1996. Many of the rules and cast remained the same from the original game show, but the series was focused on time travel and quizzing contestants on history and geography. Kevin Shinick was the host. The series lasted for two seasons and the last episode aired on October 4, 1996.

Carmen once again appears in every episode, and she's heard through conversations with criminals to give tips to contestants. In this series she's played by Janine LaManna and Brenda Burke through the two seasons.

Film

Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? (Live-Action)

A live action movie adaptation of the Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? was recently reported to being in development by Walden Media. Darren Lemke is the screenwriter but no director has been named. The movie is rumored to take a more nuanced adaptation of the games that puts into question if Carmen Sandiego is a villain or hero. Producers of the film have stated they wish the movie to have a similar tone of other movies such as National Treasure and The Thomas Crown Affair. While it's rumored that Jennifer Lopez is attached to the production, it's unknown if she will be playing Carmen or another role.
name: Carmen Sandiego
